ticket.title: Rails 3.0pre produces a conflict on new project creation
ticket.original-body:
Generating a new Rails application using Rails 3.0pre, produces a conflict because it appears to want to create a development.rb file a second time:
@@@
$ ruby 1.9.1p376 (2009-12-07 revision 26041) [i386-darwin10]
$ rails tmp create create README create .gitignore create Rakefile create config.ru create Gemfile create app create app/controllers/application_controller.rb create app/helpers/application_helper.rb create app/models create app/views/layouts create config create config/routes.rb create config/application.rb create config/environment.rb create config/environments create config/environments/development.rb conflict config/environments/development.rb Overwrite /Users/conradwt/rails.dir/examples/tmp/config/environments/development.rb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh]
@@@
ticket.latest-body:
Generating a new Rails application using Rails 3.0pre, produces a conflict because it appears to want to create a development.rb file a second time:
@@@
$ ruby 1.9.1p376 (2009-12-07 revision 26041) [i386-darwin10]
$ rails tmp create create README create .gitignore create Rakefile create config.ru create Gemfile create app create app/controllers/application_controller.rb create app/helpers/application_helper.rb create app/models create app/views/layouts create config create config/routes.rb create config/application.rb create config/environment.rb create config/environments create config/environments/development.rb conflict config/environments/development.rb Overwrite /Users/conradwt/rails.dir/examples/tmp/config/environments/development.rb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh]
@@@
ticket.original-body-html:
Generating a new Rails application using Rails 3.0pre, produces a conflict because it appears to want to create a development.rb file a second time:


$ ruby 1.9.1p376 (2009-12-07 revision 26041) [i386-darwin10]

$ rails tmp
      create  
      create  README
      create  .gitignore
      create  Rakefile
      create  config.ru
      create  Gemfile
      create  app
      create  app/controllers/application_controller.rb
      create  app/helpers/application_helper.rb
      create  app/models
      create  app/views/layouts
      create  config
      create  config/routes.rb
      create  config/application.rb
      create  config/environment.rb
      create  config/environments
      create  config/environments/development.rb
    conflict  config/environments/development.rb
Overwrite /Users/conradwt/rails.dir/examples/tmp/config/environments/development.rb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh]

(enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh]
@@@

Generating a new Rails application using Rails 3.0pre, produces a conflict because it appears to want to create a development.rb file a second time:


$ ruby 1.9.1p376 (2009-12-07 revision 26041) [i386-darwin10]

$ rails tmp
      create  
      create  README
      create  .gitignore
      create  Rakefile
      create  config.ru
      create  Gemfile
      create  app
      create  app/controllers/application_controller.rb
      create  app/helpers/application_helper.rb
      create  app/models

      create  config
      create  config/routes.rb
      create  config/application.rb
      create  config/environment.rb
      create  config/environments
      create  config/environments/development.rb
    conflict  config/environments/development.rb
Overwrite /Users/conradwt/rails.dir/examples/tmp/config/environments/development.rb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh]
version.title: Rails 3.0pre produces a conflict on new project creation

version.body:
I could not reproduce on master:
git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git ruby rails/railties/bin/rails tempapp
Can you?
version.body-html:
I could not reproduce on master:

git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git
ruby rails/railties/bin/rails tempapp

Can you?
version.title: Rails 3.0pre produces a conflict on new project creation

version.body:
I performed the following operations:
@@@
git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git cd rails git submodule init git submodule update sudo rake install cd rails tempapp
@@@
Next, this happens consistently following the above on my MacBook Pro (Intel) but I wasn't able to reproduce this on the PowerMac G5 (PPC). Now, I'm seeing the same issue on MacBook Pro (Intel) when I try the following:
@@@
git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git ruby rails/railties/bin/rails tempapp
@@@
Finally, this doesn't happen when using Rails 2.3.5.
version.body-html:
I performed the following operations:


git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git
cd rails
git submodule init
git submodule update
sudo rake install
cd
rails tempapp

Next, this happens consistently following the above on my MacBook Pro (Intel) but I wasn't able to reproduce
this on the PowerMac G5 (PPC). Now, I'm seeing the same issue on MacBook Pro (Intel) when I try the following:


git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git
ruby rails/railties/bin/rails tempapp

Finally, this doesn't happen when using Rails 2.3.5.
version.title: Rails 3.0pre produces a conflict on new project creation

version.body: This is odd! I definitely cannot reproduce here or anyone in the core team. Have you tried reinstalling 1.9.1 in rvm? (I use 1.9.1 from rvm as well)
version.body-html: This is odd! I definitely cannot reproduce here or anyone in the core team. Have you tried reinstalling 1.9.1 in rvm? (I use 1.9.1 from rvm as well)
version.title: Rails 3.0pre produces a conflict on new project creation

version.body: I installed Ruby 1.9.1p376 using MacPorts on both laptop (i.e. MacBook Pro) and desktop (i.e. PowerMac G5).
version.body-html: I installed Ruby 1.9.1p376 using MacPorts on both laptop (i.e. MacBook Pro) and desktop (i.e. PowerMac G5).
version.title: Rails 3.0pre produces a conflict on new project creation

version.body: I cannot duplicate at all. This problem still happens? Any extra information?
version.body-html: I cannot duplicate at all. This problem still happens? Any extra information?

version.body: Ok, I'm closing this one. I will reopen if you have any information on how to reproduce it.

version.body: Jose, I cannot reproduce this issue either after upgrading to the Rails 3.0.0 beta.
